column4: why go through all this for 64 bit when from what i've read it's not really much faster vs just using i386 compiled versions?

for those of us who are still new to linux, though, we've been buying into microshaft's demands for bigger, newer, more powerful hardware for their so-called-wonderful new os's for so long...it's hard to give up that way of thinking...it's been so ingrained

well my knowledge of 64bit arch is pretty limited, but one of the big benefits I believe is being able to address a lot more memory.  This has advantages for servers much more than for desktop users.  And that's great and all, but when your going to run into so many problems with various software, I'd personally just stick to 386 for the time being
